page.title: 18AIRFIELD
page.content: The Wellington Bomber is one of the many war planes that took part in World War 2.The proper name for the Wellington Bomber is the Vickers Wellington bomber.They would land at the airport near Atherstone-on-Stour and then they would tow them to the airstrip which we saw at Orchard Hill Farm.They would tie them down to the ground on to iron bars,so they would not blow away or bump into each other and then they would throw a net over them to camouflage them.This was because they did not want the Germans to know it was an English airfield and it would not be attacked.This aeroplane went to Germany to bomb their factories where they were making weapons,planes and tanks to use against this country. Martin Hicks and Christopher McClean. both aged nine.
